intro: Corchorus rostratus, commonly known as the spiny pigweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, triangular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
